summary: This is an email chain regarding setting up a Relativity database for the case U.S. v. Epstein, 2018R01618. It involves coordination between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and FBI personnel to grant access and upload initial investigation materials, with anticipation of receiving a large batch of documents soon.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Sent a form to gain access to Relativity and is part of the New York VCAC/Human Trafficking unit.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Requests the setup of a Relativity database for the Epstein case, specifies access for AUSAs, themselves, FBI agents, and paralegals, and outlines the initial document upload process.

connections.description: Collaborating on setting up document access and database for the Epstein investigation, as indicated by being copied on the same email chain.

events.title: Relativity Database Setup Request
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney requests the setup of a Relativity database for the case U.S. v. Epstein, 2018R01618, and coordinates access and initial document upload with FBI personnel.

locations: 26 Federal Plaza, New York, New York 10278
keyFacts: The document is part of the case U.S. v. Epstein, 2018R01618.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney is coordinating with the FBI to set up a Relativity database for document review in the Epstein investigation.
Initial documents to be uploaded are from an FBI case file dated 2018-12-04, with a large batch of case files expected soon.
Access to the database is to be granted to AUSAs, the requesting attorney, FBI agents, and paralegals.
The correspondence indicates an active phase of evidence gathering and review in early 2019.
